com.soa.soap.message
Class SOAPExchange

java.lang.Object
  com.soa.message.AbstractExchange
      com.soa.soap.message.SOAPExchange
All Implemented Interfaces:
Exchange
public class SOAPExchange
extends AbstractExchange

Implementation of AbstractExchange for SOAP message exchanges.

Since:
5.1

Constructor Detail

SOAPExchange

public SOAPExchange(SOAPMessageFactory factory,
                    SOAPVersion version)
Creates the SOAPExchange of the specified SOAP version. Specifying the SOAP version of the exchange is optimal because it precludes the need to parse messages with pre-existing content to determine their version.

Parameters:
factory - SOAPMessageFactory used to create messages in the exchange.
version - SOAPVersion of the exchange.

SOAPExchange

public SOAPExchange(SOAPMessageFactory factory)
Creates the SOAPExchange. Since there is no specified version, the version of the exchange will be determined by the INPUT message.

Parameters:
factory - SOAPMessageFactory used to create messages in the exchange.
Method Detail

setFactory

public void setFactory(SOAPMessageFactory factory)
Configures the SOAPMessageFactory used to create SOAP messages.

Parameters:
factory - SOAPMessageFactory used to create SOAP messages.

getVersion

public SOAPVersion getVersion()
                       throws GException
Returns the SOAP version of the exchange.

Returns:
SOAPVersion of the exchange. If the exchange was not created with a version and there is no INPUT message with a known version, the version will be null.
Throws:
GException - TODO

getStyle

public java.lang.String getStyle()
Returns the style of the exchange which is dictated by the SOAP binding.

Returns:
Style of the exchange, see DOCUMENT_STYLE and RPC_STYLE.

setStyle

public void setStyle(java.lang.String style)
Configures the style of the exchange which is dictated by the SOAP binding.

Parameters:
style - Style of the exchange, see DOCUMENT_STYLE and RPC_STYLE.

getUse

public java.lang.String getUse()
Returns the use of the exchange which is dictated by the SOAP binding.

Returns:
Use of the exchange, see LITERAL_USE and ENCODED_USE.

setUse

public void setUse(java.lang.String use)
Configures the use of the exchange which is dictated by the SOAP binding.

Parameters:
use - Use of the exchange, see LITERAL_USE and ENCODED_USE.

setVersion

public void setVersion(SOAPVersion version)
Configures the SOAP version of the exchange. Specifying the SOAP version of the exchange is optimal because it precludes the need to parse messages with pre-existing content to determine their version.

Parameters:
version - SOAPVersion of the exchange.

createFault

public SOAPMessage createFault(FaultInformation faultInfo,
                               javax.xml.transform.Source detail)
                        throws GException
Creates a SOAP fault from the given content. Since no version is specified in this signature, the default version (1.1) is used.

Parameters:
faultInfo - FaultInformation holding core fault parameters. Required.
detail - Source holding application fault information. Optional.
Returns:
SOAPMessage with the fault.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to create the fault. Most likely caused by the absence of a fault code or an invalid detail.

setMessage

public void setMessage(SOAPMessage msg,
                       ParameterType pType)
                throws GException
Adds a SOAP message to the exchange.

Parameters:
msg - SOAPMessage to add to the exchange.
pType - ParameterType of the message being added to the exchange.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to add the message to the exchange.

createMessage

protected Message createMessage()
                         throws GException
Creates a message using the version of the exchange.

Specified by:
createMessage in class AbstractExchange
Returns:
Created Message.
Throws:
GException - Thrown if unable to create the message.
